title: How to Make a Marble Mocha Macchiato

steps.headline: Fill a metal pitcher 3/5 of the way full with milk.
Insert steam wand halfway into the milk and move the pitcher in a circular motion around the wand.
steps.description: This creates the rich foam that's needed for a real macchiato.

steps.headline: Steam the milk until it reaches 150 degrees.
Grab your glass!
steps.description: Pour in equal parts of both mocha syrup and white mocha syrup. Use one pump of each for every 4 ounces (110 g). So, for example, a 16 ounce drink (a normal 'Grande' at Starbucks) would use 4 pumps of each syrup, 8 pumps total.

steps.headline: Pull 2 shots of espresso from an at-home espresso maker.
Pour your steamed milk in your glass over your syrup, but leave 2 inches (5.1 cm) of room from the top for foam and espresso.
Using a spoon, scoop the foam from inside of the pitcher and add it to the top of your drink, still leaving an inch of room for espresso.
Add your shots of espresso!
steps.description: (Thereby 'marking' your milk with espresso, which is where the name macchiato comes from!) (Optional) Drizzle mocha syrup in a crosshatch pattern on the top of your foam for a more gourmet look.

steps.headline: Drink, enjoy, and share with your friends!

text: Fill a metal pitcher 3/5 of the way full with milk.  Insert steam wand halfway into the milk and move the pitcher in a circular motion around the wand. This creates the rich foam that's needed for a real macchiato. Steam the milk until it reaches 150 degrees.  Grab your glass! Pour in equal parts of both mocha syrup and white mocha syrup. Use one pump of each for every 4 ounces (110 g). So, for example, a 16 ounce drink (a normal 'Grande' at Starbucks) would use 4 pumps of each syrup, 8 pumps total. Pull 2 shots of espresso from an at-home espresso maker.  Pour your steamed milk in your glass over your syrup, but leave 2 inches (5.1 cm) of room from the top for foam and espresso.  Using a spoon, scoop the foam from inside of the pitcher and add it to the top of your drink, still leaving an inch of room for espresso.  Add your shots of espresso! (Thereby 'marking' your milk with espresso, which is where the name macchiato comes from!) (Optional) Drizzle mocha syrup in a crosshatch pattern on the top of your foam for a more gourmet look. Drink, enjoy, and share with your friends!
